data.text: @PhotographerWRS @Reuters Children have been growing into adulthood forever without the adults around them covering half their face. I had numerous bouts with strep throat, colds, flu and chicken pox. I am still here and my immune system is stronger for it.
@JemmingKristin @Reuters The question is why would you not want to protect others including children?
@Phantasmasoria @Reuters You can keep wearing them if you want. ;-)

@badmood_miss @Reuters I’m not sure people will be *willing* to go back to mitigations when things get worse once again. That is my concern with the CDCs new guidance. So I’m staying out in the woods and avoiding plague rats ;)
@PhotographerWRS @Reuters Have you done so all throughout your life to protect these people then, or just since this one particular virus that you were taught to live in fear of?

@JemmingKristin @Reuters 5 year olds are always at risk? There is very little I would not do to protect others. I would not hesitate to do something as simple as wearing a mask if it mean lessening the chance of infecting a child.
@HoeflerBenjamin @Reuters I’m not sure what this has to do with wearing a mask.
@PhotographerWRS @Reuters Well I got the jab cause I care about others and now I have myocarditis.
